column2: "value": "Museu do A\u00e7ude was created in 1964 by  industrialist Raymundo Ottoni de Castro Maya
column3: owner of Gordura de C\u00f4co Carioca. A man of many virtues
column4: Castro Maya was an important collector of Brazilian art and a nature lover. In 1943 he coordinated the reform and development of Tijuca Forest. In the early 1990s
column6: curator [Marcio Doctors][1] was invited by the then director of the museum
column8: to devise a project that interrelated contemporary art and nature. The result
column10: was an exhibition of temporary installations that interacted with Tijuca Forest
column11: listed by the national heritage protection agency
column14: Marcio Doctors conceived of a Space for Permanent Installations
column15: building up a collection of contemporary art for Museu do A\u00e7ude
column16: where he reconfigured the old bourgeois idea of the sculpture garden into a space (alluding to the cosmos) for permanent installations. A pioneering project in Brazil
column17:
it won the Estácio de Sá award in 2004 from the Rio de Janeiro state government for its excellence and relevance to the history of Brazilian art.


  [1]: http://www.marciodoctors.com.br"}
column22: "alternate_names": ["Marcio Doctors || Arquivo Marcio Doctors - art and philosophy."]
